constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 175 (Tuesday, October 5, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. SCHAKOWSKY:
H.R. 5502.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 3
The Congress shall have Power . . . To regulate Commerce
with foreign Nations, and among the several States, and with
the Indian Tribes.
[Page H5601]

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

title: To require online marketplaces to verify certain information regarding high-volume third party sellers of consumer products on such online marketplaces and to disclose to consumers certain contact and other information regarding such high-volume third party sellers.
